titlestmt.subtitle: A description of the collection at Syracuse University
titlestmt.author: MRC

list.item: 1 Jun 2016 - link to full inventory added (MRC)

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Collection consists of manufactured objects made of various types of plastic.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: The Plastics Artifact Collection was accumulated originally by the National Plastics Center and Museum (NPCM) in Leominster, Massachusetts. Begun in 1970 as a cooperative effort of the Pioneer Valley Section of the Society of Plastics Engineers and several local Leominster Historians, the NPCM was incorporated in 1982 and acquired a building in Leominster in the mid 1980s. In addition to maintaining documents and artifacts documenting the history and development of plastics and related engineering fields, the NPCM initiated a national outreach program to schools (including the traveling PlastiVan) and inaugurated the Plastics Hall of Fame. In 2008 NPCM transferred its manuscript collections and artifactual holdings to the Special Collections Research Center at Syracuse University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The Plastics Artifact Collection is a supplement to the numerous manuscript collections relating to organizations and individuals who played a significant role in the development and manufacture of plastic products in the United States. Objects include personal items (combs, brushes), toys, dishes, decorative objects, housewares, medical equipment, automotive components, material samples, and more.

altformavail.head: Other Formats Available
altformavail.p: Many of the items have been photographed and may be viewed on the Plastics website.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: Artifacts are in no particular order.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Special Collections Research Center has numerous holdings in the areas of plastics and industrial design. Please refer to &subjindex; for a complete listing. See also the Plastics website for digital images of more than 2000 plastic artifacts and a wide range of material on the history and development of plastics.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: THE ENTIRE COLLECTION IS CLOSED FOR REHOUSING DURING THE SUMMER OF 2019.

The majority of our archival and manuscript collections are housed offsite and require advanced notice for retrieval. Researchers are encouraged to contact us in advance concerning the collection material they wish to access for their research.
Kit in Oversize 224 is not accessible to researchers due to presence of asbestos.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Written permission must be obtained from SCRC and all relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any materials in this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Bulk, gift of the National Plastics Center and Museum, 2008. Additional items, gifts of various donors, 2009-present.

note.p: THE ENTIRE COLLECTION IS CLOSED FOR REHOUSING DURING THE SUMMER OF 2019.

The inventory for this collection is not currently available online, due to an ongoing rehousing project. To locate or request specific items, please contact the repository listed above. Many of the items have been photographed and may be viewed on the Plastics website.
